div.p: SCHEUCHZERIA, in botany: A genus of the trigynia order, belonging to the hexandria claſs of plants; and in the natural method ranking under the fifth order, Triρelatoideae. The calyx is ſexpartite; there is no corolla, nor are there any ſtyles; there are three inflated and monoſpermous capſules.
